intro: Crotalaria brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed cowpea or the dwarf rattlebox, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in inflated, ribbed pods, which burst open to disperse the seeds. Crotalaria brevipes is often found in disturbed soils and is used in some regions for forage or traditional medicine.
